positive.review:
Introduction

Wolfenstein: The New Order, developed by MachineGames and published by Bethesda Softworks in 2014, revitalizes one of the oldest and most iconic first-person shooter franchises. It blends classic run-and-gun gameplay with a surprisingly emotional story, offering a fresh perspective on an alternate history where the Nazis won World War II.

Story

The game follows veteran soldier B.J. Blazkowicz as he awakens from a 14-year coma in a dystopian 1960s world dominated by the Nazi regime. The narrative is far more mature and character-driven than previous entries, exploring themes of resistance, trauma, and hope. The writing gives depth to both heroes and villains, transforming what could have been a simple revenge story into a compelling human drama. The world-building is impressiveâ€”players explore everything from Nazi strongholds to moon bases, each filled with unsettling details about this twisted alternate reality.

Gameplay

At its core, The New Order is a fast-paced first-person shooter that balances old-school gunplay with modern design elements. Dual-wielding machine guns, stealth mechanics, and upgradeable weapons create multiple ways to approach combat. The pacing is excellentâ€”intense firefights alternate with quieter, story-driven moments that keep players emotionally invested. The AI is aggressive enough to keep you on your toes, and the difficulty curve feels fair. However, some stealth sections can feel a bit clunky compared to more modern standards.

Graphics

For a game released in 2014, The New Order still looks impressive. The environments are detailed and varied, from ruined European cities to high-tech Nazi facilities. The use of lighting and shadows enhances the grim atmosphere, and character models convey emotion effectively during cutscenes. While not cutting-edge by todayâ€™s standards, the visual design remains strong and cohesive.

Sound

The soundtrack, composed by Mick Gordon and others, perfectly complements the gameâ€™s toneâ€”dark, heavy, and cinematic. Gunfire and explosions sound impactful, while the voice acting, particularly for B.J. Blazkowicz, adds emotional depth. The subtle ambient sounds in quieter sections build tension and immersion, making the world feel alive and dangerous.

Conclusion

Wolfenstein: The New Order succeeds in blending classic FPS action with an unexpectedly powerful story. Itâ€™s a game that respects its roots while pushing the series forward in meaningful ways. Although not without small flaws in stealth mechanics and pacing, it remains one of the most memorable single-player shooters of its generation.

Final Score: 9/10

If I could somehow bottle the sheer joy I feel at the prospect of killing space Nazis on the moon I would make a fortune! 
If you feel frustrated with life and just want a good time where you see a lot of bad people get splattered then this is the game for you! Killing Nazis, its like a stress ball with less guilt!
Great game but I got black listed by the United States government for playing it.
Good game. Although the game felt quite easy even on the higher difficulties. I guess it's because I am very good at FPS games

I can start this topic with the joy of finishing a wonderful game I was late playing.

â€¢ From the moment I started the game until the very last scene, I felt like I'd entered the script of a beautiful movie. I can say that this is a rare experience in games. It's fluid and immersive, and you can't put it down.

â€¢ Technically, the game only offered a maximum of 60 fps, and such limitations can diminish my enjoyment. There were a few minor bugs here and there, but I don't think they're major issues.

â€¢ All in all, I recommend it to anyone who enjoys story-driven FPS games. I think you'll enjoy it. Have fun!

My score is: 9/10.
Beautifully ugly, satisfyingly gory, elegantly written, and extremely fun Nazi-extermination action. Recommend, without a doubt.

Awesome game.
Should do UBER mode as your first run because you get to experience the game.
You can ignore the collectibles until you're done with Uber; just do another run,
Another amazing Wolfenstein game. The story line is phenomenal. The gameplay is superb. An absolute banger of a game!
good game ngl, my only critique is it should have been somehow semi-open world like Dishonred 1

all the good things from modern fps games and then some
+ great characters and dialogue that feel believable
+ awesome well-writen badass protag
great game, nowadays it's hard to find linear pure fps games and this one delivers exactly that. it also offers a good amount of gameplay variety.
Astonishingly well-written, considering the franchise it comes from. Really impressive. And lots of fun too. Can't not recommend it.
Very good game. Great story. Amazing gameplay. 10/10 i recommend

Perhaps I let this get too hyped up in my head. I had always heard that this and it's sequel were fantastic games, but what I experienced was really just a pretty good FPS title.

This DOES have a lot of things going for it - despite the common opinion that they're overdone, I do generally love WW2 setting for movies and games, and I've only come to like it more as I've gotten older, so even though this is like crazy alternate timeline that was a plus. The soundtrack (though I didn't always notice it) was also cool, shoutout Mick Gordon. And it's also an FPS, which I truly just almost always enjoy.

But honestly, that's mostly it. Other than the gameplay feeling very solid all around, this left me wanting a lot more. The story did not really click with me at all. I get that it's a Wolfenstein game and maybe I'm expecting a bit much out of it, but again, I had heard it praised so highly. So many moments that just didn't really make any sense, and way too many characters to really feel any attachment to them in the short runtime.

I'm open to being surprised with the sequel (whenever I decide to get around to that), but this just didn't work as well as I wanted it to in a few areas. That being said, it IS still very satisfying to go into a room guns-blazing and start mowing down some Nazis, and that's more than I can say for some other things I've played.

I've actually played this last year and I got to motivate myself finishing all the achievements after I played the prequel The Old Blood. This was absolutely a blast of an fps game. It's not just your typical shoot and run, their are other mechanics which are interesting, well for me at least. The mini boss and boss was a masterpiece fight, the cutscenes were also amazing, especially those scenes. The only thing that I kind of find frustrating really is the collectibles, luckily last year I got some of it so when I replay the game, I only have few things to collect, which I though was easy but was not. Overall 9/10. Highly recommend playing and buying including the other games, though I haven't played The New Colossus yet.
an FPS with plot and good design. a rarity in our current world. thank you game. i doubt I'll see many more like it within the next decade due to capitalism. Enjoy it.
Never played this game seen it in the past But what a game good story and better atmosphere! this was made in 2014 and damn this looks good!
very fun game, very fun gun play, atmospheric, interesting story line
very good, very cool gameplay, the boss fights are lackluster, but the story and characters is very intense and well done,
Very fun game that lets you play any style you want (whether you want to play more stealth like or go guns blazing). The story is really engaging and fun. Would highly recommend

The story and gameplay are genuinely good. Enough weapon choices to suit different play styles. A good mix of easy and hard areas, and somewhat hard bosses. You don't have to recollect hidden collectibles if you die before an autosave, which is a nice QOL feature. The gunplay is fun, but nothing special.

A downside to this game is the 60FPS limit, but it can be unlocked with a mod. The mod introduces some minor issues that can be overlooked, but causes 7 soft-locks which require FPS to be locked again until the next autosave.

This game also has issues with HDR, but it only happens when you close the game and is fixed by turning HDR off then back on.

I took to long to refund so I am stuck with a game I cant refund so I ended up buying it twice. Once on steam and the second time through my xbox one. And does anyone know why this game is harder to run than Middle Earth Shadow  of War.
- Better than COD

games great. unlike doom you actually have to pay attention to the environment

yo this game is really fUCKING GOOD
so at first imo it was kind of hard but i replayed it a few times.has a really good song too [haus in neu berlin]
there were SOME historical inaccuracies but still a good game, whoever voice acted were amazing vas, especially the german ones
very adrenaline fueling
Really fun to play, both on the harder challenge levels and on the easier casual levels.
Top game, played through the whole story twice. Uber difficulty was sometimes a bit nonsense, but other than that I love everything about this game <3
dude this game slaps and is the bestest game ever if you like germany. das ist gut, mein fruend

This game is such an underrated classic. I'd go as far to say its on the list of one of the best single player fps games ever made. The graphics are a bit dated, but if youre able, utilize Nvidia RTX Dynamic Vibrance and RTX HDR to  polish things up a bit. The story is solid, the fights are engaging, and there's nothing like blowing off the limbs of nazis and make them look like hamburger. 10/10
Nice Gameplay, Great Graphics. Story could be longer but overall nice.

Beautiful story. When I started playing I wasn't sure I was going to like it. As I went on it just got better and better. The ending is also one of the greatest endings I have ever played! Its a shame the second game ruins the ending of this one. 10/10
this game has a lot of action . It keeps you on your toes. Fast paced and lots of twists and turns. Plenty of levels to keep you interested in the game.

This game is Doom, but with Nazis instead of demons. Best way I can put it.

Shoot nazis kill nazis stab nazis 

It's good mindless fun from a gameplay perspective.

The story is basically the nazis find out that Jews have invented crazy technologies and they steal them to conquer the world. It's wild. I loved finding the newsclips to find out what's actually going on outside of the campaign.
the game run good and junk and it also have is the good grafics
One thing I love about Wolfenstein games, especially this one, is that it makes me hate Nazis more and then gives me the outlet to annihilate these fascist bastards by the score.

It's like nÃ¼-doom except with monsternazis instead of demons. plus your character says weird lines in a badass voice. 
NO swastikas because Germany wouldn't let them sell the game if it had them
NO skeletons because China wouldn't let them sell the game if it had them

This game can be summarised as 

"Each and every man under my command owes me 100 Nazi scalps and I want my scalps and all y'all will get me 100 Nazi scalps taken from the heads of 100 dead Nazis. Or you will die tryin'." 10/10 would scalp Nazis again

Its a good game, plus the map has good detail. Gameplay is fun, basic shooter with plenty of gun options. If your up, find all the enigma code papers throughout the game to unlock some extra game mode.

One of my favorite games of all time. A rare AAA game that is bold and unafraid to be truly political. 

The storytelling and characters are INCREDIBLE. So is the gunplay, the art direction, the music. Everything. 

MachineGames are such a talented studio. 

Also hits different in 2025... Very eerie now
Old school FPS with a great story and awesome weapons. The graphics hold up very well. I'd say if it had higher textures, you would never know it was an older title.
Lovely game. Good story and not too long

the game is very awesome, fast movement, amazing guns, amazing models, the amazing of everything. would personally recommend if you're looking for a good fast paced shooting story game, definitely one of the best games i have completed so far, would recommend!

The game isnâ€™t just about mowing down Nazis (though itâ€™s amazing at that). Itâ€™s a fast, intense shooter with a story that hits harder than youâ€™d expect.

B.J. Blazkowicz isnâ€™t just a killing machineâ€”heâ€™s weary, human, and driven by hope in a world thatâ€™s already lost. The resistance characters are memorable, the world-building is fantastic, and the mix of over-the-top action and emotional storytelling is perfect.

The gunplay feels heavy and satisfying, stealth actually works, and the alternate-history setting is pure pulp brilliance.

8.5/10 â€“ One of the best single-player FPS experiences out there.

They couldn't make this game today.

Truly one of the better games in my collection, looking forward to playing The New Colossus, I had a great amount of fun playing the campaign, would have loved to see operations, but given its relatively low price, and long campaign, I am by no means disappointed.

The political message behind this game is incredible. as it always will be, killing nazis is fun, very fun.
What can I say? This game embodies what a lot of us feel towards a certain group of the pure evil that is the villians represented in this game. The gunplay is fantastic. Enough said.

Wolfenstein: The New Order â€” A Daring Fight Against Tyranny

Wolfenstein: The New Order isnâ€™t just a first-person shooter; itâ€™s an exceptional blend of intense combat, immersive storytelling, and cinematic action. From Nazi-occupied cities to heavily fortified strongholds, every environment is packed with enemies, hidden paths, and adrenaline-charged encounters that keep players fully engaged.

Combat is fast, satisfying, and brutal. Each weapon, melee attack, and tactical choice changes how you approach every firefight, making encounters feel dynamic and strategic. Sneaking past guards, executing daring assaults, and experimenting with weaponry turns every battle into a thrilling test of skill and reflexes. Heavily armed enemies and boss fights demand precision, timing, and creativity.

Exploration and level design are equally rewarding. Hidden collectibles, secret areas, and optional challenges encourage players to engage with the world and master every combat scenario. The pacing balances intense action with moments of quiet tension, keeping the experience fresh and compelling.

The story is gripping and cinematic. Wolfenstein: The New Order combines over-the-top action with a deeply personal narrative, featuring memorable characters, emotional stakes, and striking alternate-history storytelling that elevates it above a typical shooter.

Visually, the game impresses. Detailed environments, realistic character models, and explosive effects make every firefight, explosion, and scripted moment feel cinematic. Coupled with a dramatic, pulse-pounding soundtrack, the game delivers an unforgettable sensory experience.

[h3]Final Verdict:[/h3]
Wolfenstein: The New Order is a high-octane, story-driven shooter that blends intense combat, immersive storytelling, and cinematic spectacle. Fast, thrilling, and emotionally resonant, itâ€™s a must-play for fans of adrenaline-fueled adventures.

"A gripping, action-packed shooter with heart, spectacle, and nonstop intensity."

Overall Rating: â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â˜† 9/10
Overall pretty good, fun game, good gameplay, good characters, plot was written by a 13 yo with an unhealthy addiction to ww2. Recommend under $20
Good writing is pretty important in a game huh
What's better than killing nazis? I think the grafics are great, the story is nice.

I installed this to replay a second time, because I needed to remember how to deal with Nazis. Such a fun, action-packed, thrilling game.

Visuals that hold up, cringeworthy writing, and lots of n*zi killing - just awesome!
Great story. there is many love from the publisher in this game.
love killing nazis and cant wait to shoot hitler in the nuts with a double barell
Amazing FPS, great story, must have for Wolfenstein fans.

I played Wolfenstein: The New Order more than five years ago (and before that, when my PC couldn't handle it, I watched a playthrough on YouTube) and I still think about it to this day.

It is Monday, 8 AM where I live, and I'm here thinking about how freaking cool The New Order (TNO) and The Old Blood (TOB) were and how there's no other FPS that even come close in the last decade (aside from, maybe, Metro Exodus). Every so often I remember the chapter "Under Attack" from TNO, and how the music Ransacked by Mick Gordon made this whole sequence so special. I could even quote B.J.'s entire speech at the end of TOB, word for word, and how impactful it felt knowing the operation B.J. was heading to at that point would lead to the sad and memorable sequence at the opening of TNO... it is perfect, really.

The plot is very well written and all the voice actors delivered a great performance, specially Brian Bloom (B.J.), and I can hardly express how good it is to play a FPS game where the main character is well developed through dialogue without yapping all the time. Aside from Wolfenstein reboot, I would say my favorite FPS games are Half-Life 2, BioShock 1 and Metro. 
- About HL2, I couldn't care less about Gordon Freeman: I know he earned a Ph.D. in theoretical physics on MIT and that's all. That's the whole character right there. No wonder I think Alyx is a much better character. Why is Gordon unable do speak, really? 
- About Metro, I think Artyom is underutilized ingame: the dude is totally able to speak, but he just doesn't. By result there's a lot of monologues from other characters that very often say something silly like "oh, you don't talk that much, right?" and makes me even more pissed that, for some reason, our character do not speak ingame.
- Jack from BioShock is also a silent protagonist, but maybe that makes a little more sense than Artyom or Gordon considering his background.
B.J. could have been another silent protagonist, but he is not. As a result, I care much more when something happens to him. And there is A LOT happening throughout TOB and TNO, it is a very sad tale.

All that to say that the protagonist itself is top notch, an unfortunately uncommon quality in the FPS genre. The plot is also amazing, the gameplay is superb (being objectively better than HL2 and BioShock gameplaywise, btw), the atmosphere is on point (I think that, MachineGames being a Swedish studio, they really knew how to express the horrors of nazism as just Europeans would be able to), it really is almost a perfect FPS game. ALMOST.

My only real complaint about The New Order (and The Old Blood, by extent) is the engine those games are made in. id Tech 5 is probably the worst iteration of the id Tech family, by far. The anti-aliasing is bad, textures are vey slow to render and to make matters worse, it's capped at 60 fps. Rage, developed by id Software, uses the same engine and shares the same problems, btw. id Tech 6 was a giant improvement and made games like Doom 2016 and Wolfenstein The New Colossus not only look better, but also run WAY better. It seems to have become fashionable to release some kind of free update for old games at every QuakeCon, and I'm always hoping that the chosen game at the next edition will be The New Order (and The Old Blood, if possible). I've seen a lot of much less necessary "remasters" out there.
Story is good shooting is good lots of nazis
Good To many reading exposition But very good adrenaline rush
Take a gun, kill n****. Nice, classic good old feeling game (in the best sense).
underrated game but that ending wasn't very wunderbar ğŸ˜”

Cool game and story, but to gore for me, good gameplay! Wolfenstein it's an amazing series for sure!
Fun game about killing Nazis. Inhale, count to four, exhale, count to four.

Played for the first time in 2025 and loved it. Going to power through the whole series now. Shooting felt good, classic doom style. 
Had to install a mod to get it to run over 60fps, but it was pretty easy.

streaming this game is a horrible experience. 
As for the game: Couple dumb things this game does. mobs can spawn right on you if trigger the next phase even though you've cleared that area already and should be safe. Changing weapons is backwards as well.
Otherwise enjoying the game. Only on chapter 6.
Not a bad game story wise and of course the graphics show their age but that is expected. Combat and movement wise, the game is not very smooth in that respect.
It is fun, played uber first run and.... WHY ARE THE SHOTGUN GUN GUYS AND THE ROCKET GUYS MORE BOSSES THAN ACTUAL MINI BOSS THAT IS PAIR WITH THEM.

honestly pretty good, I need to finish it tho
kill nazis fun 10/10

negative.review: First half of the game is really good and nice, Second half of the game is unbearable with how poorly designed each level is

The main gameplay loop is weirdly offputting: you're encouraged to play fast and loose, but you die too fast for that style of gameplay to be viable, so you're forced to play in a boring, crawling forward kind of way. The writing is also atrocious.

It'd be better not to play the game again...
Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus is better at everything

I played the entire game in one sitting because if I stopped midway I'd be unable to finish it. First of all, NAVIGATION sucks. The quest markers only appear on interactable buttons once you look at them. Even fully pixelated fps games like Boltgun have navigation you can toggle. It's truly retarded that you need youtube to find the right chain to cut in some levels. Also doors are inconsistently coloured. On the moon base you need to follow the red light But if the doors are mechanical then its green. On earth its usually green but then sometimes it's yellow. Level exits aren't highlighted. 
Enemies are okay but there's no indication of their weaknesses and often you will find the one good corner and abuse it to kill everything. Or do a shotgun rush. Because this game has awful environments for an fps. Often circular and with little cover, leaving you exposed to enemies you can't see. 
The story is too much for an fps. ID should really have focused on gameplay and making environments snappier and melee takedowns more gory. Also melee takedowns should give you immunity from damage. There are constant cutscenes where you would expect enemies or an open level. There are so many fucking cutscenes! And there's even a romance storyline and sex cutscenes which I don't mind but seem inappropriate for such a short game. The MC is already a badass. You don't have to establish that he is sexually powerful too. On the topic of nazis since this is a game with nazis. They could have been replaced by ubervillain #45. They're all just evil with no ideological traits at all. There's no mention of the plight of Aryan women or pagan revivalism. Also for some reason gravity is normal inside the moon base. If the nazis can control gravity to this extent then the resistance should just surrender.  There's also an entire plotline about jewish space magic and how all nazi achievements are because they stole said hebrew secrets. So they built a base on the moon but only with the power of Jewish Occultism??? The tech makes no sense. The gizmos in the game can be replaced by normal explosives and would be more useful.

I wish this game didn't try to be a cinematic shooter.

 6/10

It freezes every time I play,  at the same point , inside the bunker  I access  using the explosive: I kill the platoon at first machine gun nest then I try to go upstairs and it becomes unresponsive.  I'm thinking to ask my money back. UPDATE: I tried various workaround suggested with no success. I don't understand this absence of customer care: you can't sell it broken, if you have on catalog you must fix it or remove it from  the shop.
UPDATE : reducing the resolution from 1080p to 1600x900,  in my case,  also the crashes / freezes frequency  was drastically reduced. I think the game is still beautiful today, IT DESERVES a DEBUG.
Actually, do you know what Bethesda; this game explains very well why your company is making games unplayable for money. no offense.

I'm tired of pretending this game is good. ID continues their tradition of amazing first halves of the game and mediocre/terrible second halves. I bought it, thoroughly enjoyed it up until I got to the said second half.

The story is alright, although characters feel not developed on. Despite being the main character you talk to for the entire game, I didn't care for Anya. I was genuinely surprised that we were supposed to choose between Wyatt and Fergus because the game did not make it seem like we were supposed to care for Wyatt (I chose Fergus). Deathshead is absolutely a secondary antagonist who takes a back seat for a majority of the game (Side-note, does anyone else read it "Death-shead" and not "Deaths-head"?)

The guns are okay, although why is the double barrel limited to only two levels? I know we have a better shotgun but would've been fun using it.

The enemies are bad. Straight up. If they weren't Nazis I'd take no pleasure in killing them, and even then the pleasure is small because "buh- buh they're nazis!" takes you so far. Stealth is really easy, its just playing the game without charging in and only using the silenced pistol (Kind of upset that the sniper made sound). The worst enemies in the game by far are the shotgunners. Whoever made them should've been fired immediately. Tanky bastards who'll obliterate you. No I'm alright with Tankiness, what I'm not alright with is the fact that you have to do some weird bullshit to kill them. Robots felt oddly underwhelming, I thought we'd be seeing bigger and badder robots as the game goes on, but the robots in the third level are the baddest we get that aren't bosses.

The game feels weird too, it feels episodic akin to classic Doom, Quake, and Wolfenstein. You get weapons per level instead of collecting them as times goes on (barring a few exceptions) which would be alright, but I think the linear story along with story cutscenes IN the levels bring it down. The game should either be a whole story with way more progression (Weapon upgrades like in DOOM) or keep it episodic and heavily tone down the story segments. Not that they're bad in the game, they're just jarring.

I hated every second of this game. It looks cheap, plays cheap, and feels like a low-budget shooter pretending it's something special, not hard even on hardest difficulty.

in 4hrs, the hardest thing to do in the first cutscene when you start the game was to go to the cockpit to fix the broken canister literally, time limit X 3 cabinets and no indicator where the tools were, just to the canister so if you there crouching you would waste time and take fire dmg and the plane crashes LOL

The story is the same recycled â€œsoldier falls in love in enemy territoryâ€ nonsense. Zero originality.

Gameplay? Horrible loop:
fight â†’ cutscene â†’ fight â†’ pointless task â†’ repeat.
Same boring weapons, no meaningful upgrades, no skills, nothing that makes you feel stronger or more invested. Just mindless rinse-and-repeat.

It gives you no break, no variety, no reason to keep going. I couldnâ€™t even force myself to finish it.

If this was the last game left on earth, maybeâ€¦ maybe youâ€™d play it. Otherwise? Skip this garbage.
actually just straight up bluescreened my pc, havent had a game do that before honestly
Crashed an hour in, I'll give it another chance, but not looking good.
has a force you to chose an immoral path after the first mission. reminds me of gta4 beat the poor chinese man forced story bit. no, i don't recommend this game. i uninstalled this piece of shit.

3/10. I had a long review but Steam cleared it when I clicked the thumbs so now I refuse to retype it. Since the UI is so bad - who does that? - clear text when toggling between thumbs up/down? Who in their right mind implements that? This is my last Steam review until a proper dev works on the ui.

Play this game if you like a bullet sponge final boss. - 5
8/10 without the final boss
It's kinda boring. I was expecting more from a game about killing Nazis.
Doom (2016) set in the events of the Man in the High Castle. The over-the-top violence does not make it any less of a snoozefest.

Terribly clunky. Harder to run than games twice its age. Big oof. Shame, because it was a favorite of mine when it launched 10 years ago.

I'd say skip this one. Not even worth it on sale.

The main gameplay loop is weirdly offputting: you're encouraged to play fast and loose, but you die too fast for that style of gameplay to be viable, so you're forced to play in a boring, crawling forward kind of way. The writing is also atrocious.

Pretty good game until you reach the last missions.
The last two, awfully designed, boss fights ruined it for me.

It'd be better not to play the game again...

The enemies are bad. Straight up. If they weren't Nazis I'd take no pleasure in killing them, and even then the pleasure is small because "buh- buh they're nazis!" takes you so far. Stealth is really easy, its just playing the game without charging in and only using the silenced pistol (Kind of upset that the sniper made sound). The worst enemies in the game by far are the shotgunners. Whoever made them should've been fired immediately. Tanky bastards who'll obliterate you. No I'm alright with Tankiness, what I'm not alright with is the fact that you have to do some weird bullshit to kill them. Robots felt oddly underwhelming, I thought we'd be seeing bigger and badder robots as the game goes on, but the robots in the third level are the baddest we get that aren't bosses.

The game feels weird too, it feels episodic akin to classic Doom, Quake, and Wolfenstein. You get weapons per level instead of collecting them as times goes on (barring a few exceptions) which would be alright, but I think the linear story along with story cutscenes IN the levels bring it down. The game should either be a whole story with way more progression (Weapon upgrades like in DOOM) or keep it episodic and heavily tone down the story segments. Not that they're bad in the game, they're just jarring.
